channel.title: Changing hostname of gateway? (Whonixcheck gets mad)
channel.description:
Hello!
I have a setup where multiple gateways are on the same network. To avoid problems I changed the hostname when I changed the IP address for the other gateways. For example, instead of 10.152.152.10 the IP would be 30.152.152.10 for one of the extra gateways.
This setup works and I have tested it. My only problem is that Whonixcheck complains that the hostname has changed. I really like Whonixcheck and want to keep it enabled but I don't like seeing the errors all the time. Is there any way to get Whonixcheck to be okay with this without hacking the source? I'm worried if I hack the source I won't get updates.
Thanks!

item.title: Changing hostname of gateway? (Whonixcheck gets mad)
item.dc:creator: bitserve
item.description:
Thank you Patrick for the help and for working on Whonix. I’ll report back with some information once I get it working.

Read full topic
item.source: Changing hostname of gateway? (Whonixcheck gets mad)

item.title: Changing hostname of gateway? (Whonixcheck gets mad)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Answering to your first post. Interesting! Possible using whonixcheck settings.

whonixcheck_skip_functions+=" check_hostname "

See also:

Whonix

Whonix Configuration Files

Everything you should know about Whonix's Configuration Files.

Read full topic
item.source: Changing hostname of gateway? (Whonixcheck gets mad)

item.title: Changing hostname of gateway? (Whonixcheck gets mad)
item.dc:creator: bitserve
item.description:
entr0py:

Is this what you intended? If your goal is isolation, shouldn’t they be on separate networks? On different networks, they don’t need new IPs or Hostnames per: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Multiple_Whonix-Workstations#Multiple_Whonix-Gateways

I tried that and it didn’t seem to work I can try again. It didn’t seem to like multiple servers with the same IP address.

Read full topic
item.source: Changing hostname of gateway? (Whonixcheck gets mad)

item.title: Changing hostname of gateway? (Whonixcheck gets mad)
item.dc:creator: entr0py
item.description:
bitserve:

Is there any way to get Whonixcheck to be okay with this without hacking the source?

Don’t know.

bitserve:

I have a setup where multiple gateways are on the same network.

Is this what you intended? If your goal is isolation, shouldn’t they be on separate networks? On different networks, they don’t need new IPs or Hostnames per: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Multiple_Whonix-Workstations#Multiple_Whonix-Gateways

bitserve:

30.152.152.10 for one of the extra gateways

That address is not reserved for Private IPs. In fact, it resolves to “DoD Network Information Center” (DoD = US Dept of Defense). Very active web spider, apparently.

Read full topic
item.source: Changing hostname of gateway? (Whonixcheck gets mad)
